page.title: 19Bookham's Future Trends
page.content:
Bookham has changed dramatically since 1885, from a rural village to a suburban area of 11000 people. Further new housing must be very limited by lack of land so change may be in other ways.
One trend is the type of industrial- isation opposite the station. An engineering works, developed around a former hotel, closed & the coaches bringing in workers ceased. It has been redeveloped as an Industrial Park _32500 sq.ft of fully fitted high-tech office & industrial units are to let. Many units are still empty after 3 yrs
Another trend is an increase in garden centres. Nurseries used to thrive on the loam soils but they disappeared under houses in the 50's & 60's. Now the demand for plants has returned.
